contentrichtext.text: {{Use mdy dates|date=February 2012}} {{taxobox |image=Xylocarpus granatum.jpg |image_caption=Cannonball mangrove in the Daintree region of Queensland, Australia. |regnum = [[Plantae]] |unranked_divisio = [[Angiosperms]] |unranked_classis = [[Eudicots]] |unranked_ordo = [[Rosids]] |ordo = [[Sapindales]] |familia = [[Meliaceae]] |genus = '''''Xylocarpus''''' |genus_authority = [[Johann Gerhard König|J.Koenig]] |subdivision_ranks = [[Species]] |subdivision = ''[[Xylocarpus granatum]]'', Cannonball mangrove<br> ''[[Xylocarpus mekongensis]]'', Cedar mangrove<br> ''[[Xylocarpus moluccensis]]'', Cedar mangrove, puzzlenut |}} '''''Xylocarpus''''' is a [[genus]] of plants in the mahogany family ([[Meliaceae]]). It includes two<ref>"Xylocarpus", NPGS-GRIN database, accessed June 1, 2008. [http://www.ars-grin.gov/cgi-bin/npgs/html/splist.pl?12981]</ref> or three<ref> Raju, J.S.S.N "Xylocarpus (Meliaceae): A less-known mangrove taxon of the Godavari estuary, India". ''Current Science'', Indian Academy of Sciences, vol. 84, no. 7; April 10 2003, Pgs. 879–881 [http://www.ias.ac.in/currsci/apr102003/879.pdf]</ref> species of [[mangrove]]s, native to coastal mangrove forests of the [[Western Indo-Pacific|Western]] and [[Central Indo-Pacific|Central]] [[Indo-Pacific]], from eastern Africa to [[Tonga]]. ''Xylocarpus'' is the only mangrove genus in family Meliaceae. ==References== {{reflist|colwidth=30em}} [[Category:Mangroves]] [[Category:Meliaceae]] {{Meliaceae-stub}}
